column1: Liaozhong District (simplified Chinese: 辽中区; traditional Chinese: 遼中區; pinyin: Liáozhōng Qū) is one of ten districts of the prefecture-level city of Shenyang
column3: Northeast China. The name of the district literally means "Central Liao[ning]"
column4: referring to its central location within the province. It lies 67 km (42 mi) southwest of the downtown of Shenyang
column5: near the intersection of G1 Beijing–Harbin Expressway and G91 Liaozhong Ring Expressway. As of 2010
column8: 648 km2 (636 sq mi). It is the southernmost county-level division of Shenyang City
column9: bordering Xinmin City to the north
column10: and Tiexi District to the northeast
column11: as well as the prefecture-level cities of Liaoyang to the southeast
column12: Anshan to the south and southwest

column2: and three townships within the district.Towns:

column1: Laodafang Township (老大房乡)*Daheigangzi Township (大黑岗子乡)*Niuxintuo Township (牛心坨乡)
